page.title: 20VALE OF CLWYD HISTORIC HOUSE
page.content: The remaining part of the old Lleweni Hall is known as the red brick house and was originally a{dower house. Built of warm red brick in{flemish {bonding}it is now the farmhouse of dairy a farm. The most recent demolition took place early this century, when a small part was knocked down, there was once a huge and magnificent house there, one of the most important in Wales. The kitchen hall ceiling is supported by two huge {Tuscan pillars}& there is a semi-basement store-room with{Norman {style arches.}There is a secret tunnel reputed to run to Denbigh Castle, now unsafe. The stables and coach house, inhabited until 1950's and built in the same red brick are also standing although in a dilapidated state. The former hall was the Salusbury seat & home of{Catherine of Berain.
